articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The United States believes the remaining differences between Israel and Hamas can be bridged in negotiations over the Palestinian militant group's latest ceasefire proposal, as talks resume in Cairo on Wednesday.
articles.title: US optimistic revised Hamas proposal may break Gaza ceasefire impasse

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States has suspended a shipment of weapons to Israel, including heavy bombs the U.S. ally used in its campaign against Hamas militants in Gaza which has killed more than 34,000 Palestinians.
articles.title: What to know about the US restricting bomb shipments to Israel

articles.author: Pavel Polityuk, Gleb Garanich
articles.description: A Russian air attack on Ukraine damaged several facilities in a strike targeting energy infrastructure across the country, Ukraine's military and energy officials said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Russia targets energy facilities in air attack on Ukraine, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian air attack hit a school stadium in Ukraine's northeastern Kharkiv on Wednesday, injuring at least four children and three adults, officials said.
articles.title: Russian attack hits school stadium, injures four children in Ukraine's Kharkiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland's prime minister wants to revive a Polish commission investigating Russian influence, he said on Wednesday, amid heightened fears about espionage after a Polish judge who had access to military secrets asked for asylum in Belarus.
articles.title: Poland's Tusk seeks to revive commission to investigate Russian influence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hong Kong's appeal court on Wednesday granted an application by the government to ban a protest anthem named "Glory to Hong Kong", overturning a lower court judgement last year that had rejected the government's bid citing free speech concerns.
articles.title: Hong Kong court bans protest anthem 'Glory to Hong Kong'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. soldier Gordon Black, who has been detained the Russian city of Vladivostok until July 2, has been charged with theft causing significant damage, a Russian court said.
articles.title: Russian court says US soldier charged with theft causing 'significant' damage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Philippines' military chief accused China of a "malign influence effort" on Wednesday, after a local newspaper reported a Filipino vice admiral had made a deal with Beijing to de-escalate tensions in the South China Sea.
articles.title: Philippine military chief accuses China of 'malign influence effort'

articles.author: Luis Jaime Acosta, Carlos Vargas
articles.description: Two out of nine magistrates in Colombia's National Electoral Council (CNE) have requested an investigation be opened into Colombian President Gustavo Petro's 2022 campaign over alleged spending violations, two sources said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Colombia National Electoral Council magistrates urge investigation into Petro campaign

articles.author: Shafiek Tassiem And Esa Alexander
articles.description: Moses Malala, a 34-year-old construction worker who escaped the wreckage of a five-storey building in George, South Africa, recalled the moment it collapsed and a cloud of dust engulfed him, as rescue efforts continued at the site 48 hours on.
articles.title: Survivor recounts moment he emerged from deadly South African building collapse
